name: Flocking - primordial soup
prompt: A particle ecosystem where colored boids flock, hunt, and consume each other. Each boid has a size and a color. When a larger boid catches a smaller one, it absorbs it — growing slightly and blending their colors  together. As boids grow, they slow down and gradually lose energy, shrinking over time. Beyond a certain size they split into two smaller offspring, like cell division. Meanwhile, tiny new boids spontaneously spawn at the edges in random bright colors, replenishing the food chain. The result is a endless cycle: small fast boids swarm and scatter, mid-sized ones hunt in loose packs, and bloated giants drift slowly before dividing — a colorful, emergent food web that never reaches equilibrium.
description: A particle ecosystem where colored boids flock, hunt, and consume each other. Each boid has a size and a color. When a larger boid catches a smaller one, it absorbs it — growing slightly and blending their colors  together. As boids grow, they slow down and gradually lose energy, shrinking over time. Beyond a certain size they split into two smaller offspring, like cell division. Meanwhile, tiny new boids spontaneously spawn at the edges in random bright colors, replenishing the food chain. The result is a endless cycle: small fast boids swarm and scatter, mid-sized ones hunt in loose packs, and bloated giants drift slowly before dividing — a colorful, emergent food web that never reaches equilibrium.
